text: A comment left by mikeleffel2 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, Deusoma, ohmygooses, larkin)

name: mikebox
text: I also like the fact that Lyle won't let Phillipe see it, kind of like when he wouldn't explain the birds and bees.

name: achilleselbow
text: I thought it'd be more in keeping with Lyle's nature to let Philippe see it, then tell him to go ask Mr. Bear when the inevitable questions arose.

name: twincannon
text: Christ, he's really pissed! I love how much emotion the simple art in Achewood can convey.

text: absolutely LIVID

name: achilleselbow
text: I dunno man, green tea has been known to make me shit something fierce.

name: relaxing
text:
piss shows don't happen over glass coffee tables, bub. the coffee table ain't gonna help much unless it's got high sides such as to contain a volume of six pots of cheap green tea.

piss shows happen over a small tub or washbasin. shit shows happen over the glass coffee table. these are facts.

name: backdraft
text: That level of knowledge is disturbing...

name: tripperday
text: Thanks for the info! I figured it was a vomit show and they used tea because three shows a day with meat and potatoes would cause esophageal damage.

name: dirtyantaeus
text: I like the way Lyle is typing furiously, and barely stops to answer Philippe before going back to his furious typing.

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
Why wouldn't you want Harry Potter around for the shit show? I mean...I bet he could really make it interesting.

...more interesting.

name: petitegitan
text: Don't you remember in Harry Potter & the Sorcerer's Stone when he got pissed and the glass went away?  Maybe they didn't want to risk hurting Harry's tender sensibilities and not having the glass to protect them.

name: deusoma
text: I appear to have given you a lame. I can't recall why. I apologize for this.

text: oh god oh god oh GOD

text:
Your lames suggest that at least two achewood readers are also writers of harry potter fanfiction.

This is incredibly disturbing.

text: Trying to figure out Lyle's reasoning for making this a Harry Potter-based book at all is the funny bit... and, i suppose, Phillipe's indignation at not being able to read it.

text: The best part of this strip is that at least in that font, Lyle Gabriel looks like the name of a badass fantasy author.

text: C. Everett Koop is right, that sober Lyle in Scotland era is some of the best of the blogs.

text: This is what would happen if Rowling had died accidentally, series incomplete, and left all her intellectual properties to Thomas Pynchon.

name: stewieisgod13
text: Huh. I wouldn't have pinned Lyle for a HP fanfic writer. Odd.

name: tonyhighwind
text: That's probably because he's not. The book starts with the titular character getting knocked unconscious. Hogwarts and magical happenings are not the point of this story.

text: Yeah dogg I think Harry Potter is only tangentially related to Stiv Bators and the Vietnamese hooker

name: direhaggis
text: It is a point of fact that I am blown away that any activity would leave Lyle not clutching his booze.

text: Six pots of green tea, a glass table, hmmm, what is going on here?

name: gopacapulco
text: Dead BoyS!

text:
Who has the same initials as Lyle?

Me (I do).

name: empy
text:
He's right to not show him.
That stuff ends childhoods.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: but Philippe is Five, and when that 'f' is capitalized, it means he will be that age forever.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it's not that he doesn't want Philippe to read his. he just doesn't want to 'waste his time' reading Philippe's.

name: hendetta
text:
Lyle is the kind of guy who knows when a kid is or isn't ready. Philippe has another breakdown, while Lyle takes a silent drink with his back to the door.

"I'm SPECIAL. Children are SPECIAL."
